meanings.definition: Dehiscing: Bursting open or splitting along a natural line to release contents.
meanings.sent1: The ripe fruit was dehiscing, revealing juicy seeds inside.
meanings.sent2: The flower dehisced, scattering its pollen in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The piñata dehisced with such force that candies flew everywhere!
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was dehiscing, letting out all the pent-up emotions.
meanings.sent5: The old chest dehisced, revealing a hidden compartment filled with treasures.

meanings.definition: Dehiscing: Opening up to release spores or seeds.
meanings.sent1: The mushroom cap dehisced, spreading spores into the air.
meanings.sent2: The pine cone dehisced, scattering seeds on the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn bag dehisced unexpectedly, causing a popcorn shower.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter dehisced like a burst of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The volcano dehisced, unleashing a flow of molten lava down its slopes.
